com.vmware.vapi.config

Class SpringConfigurator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vmware.vapi.config.SpringConfigurator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurator

    public class SpringConfigurator
extends Object
implements Configurator
    Creates vAPI runtime objects from a Spring config/application context.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpringConfigurator

        public SpringConfigurator(List<String> configFiles)
        Constructor.

        Creates an instance that load Spring application context and configures the infrastructure based on the specified configuration files.

        It is expected that in the provided configuration

        • exactly 1 bean exists with id="apiProvider" and that bean is of type LocalProvider or ApiAggregator
        • 1 or more beans of types descendant of ProtocolHandler exists
        The above beans are the result from Configurator interface methods implemented by this class.
        Parameters:
        configFiles - Spring XML configuration files, must be available on the classpath
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if configFiles is null or empty

      • SpringConfigurator

        public SpringConfigurator(String uri,
                  String providerSpringConfig)
        Constructor.

        Creates an instance that uses the specified uri and optionally providerSpringConfig to configure the infrastructure.

        Instances created with this constructor uses default configuration for JSON/HTTP ProtocolHandler. HTTP server uses HTTP listener only (no HTTPS). The configuration is available from:

        • vapi-tcserver-spring.xml
        • vapi-http-spring.xml

        Custom Spring XML configuration may be provided with the providerSpringConfig. If provided it will be loaded and a bean with id id="apiProvider" will be used by this configurator.

        Parameters:
        uri - HTTP URL for server to listen on
        providerSpringConfig - Spring XML configuration files supposed to contain definition for ApiProvider to be used' must be available on the classpath; must not be null
        See Also:
        SpringConfigurator(List)

      • SpringConfigurator

        public SpringConfigurator(String uri,
                  String secureUri,
                  String keystore,
                  String password,
                  String keypassword,
                  String providerSpringConfig)
        Constructor.

        Creates an instance that uses the specified uri and optionally providerSpringConfig to configure the infrastructure.

        Instances created with this constructor uses default configuration for JSON/HTTP ProtocolHandler. HTTP server uses HTTPS listener optionally HTTP one. The configuration is available from:

        • vapi-tcserver-spring.xml
        • vapi-http-spring.xml
        • vapi-https-spring.xml
        Parameters:
        uri - HTTP URL for server to listen on
        secureUri - HTTPS URL for server to listen on
        keystore - SSL keystore
        password - password for the SSL keystore
        keypassword - password for the SSL key
        providerSpringConfig - Spring XML configuration files supposed to contain definition for ApiProvider to be used' must be available on the classpath; must not be null
        See Also:
        SpringConfigurator(String, String), SpringConfigurator(List)
